51e1f956-c324-41eb-9eae-f5ab8fd777ee.description: The badge earner demonstrated competency and knowledge in foundational cooking techniques, kitchen and food safety, knife skills, stocks, moist- and dry-heat cooking methods, plating and presentation, and culinary nutrition. The badge earner can prepare a variety of salads, vegetables, soups, sauces, meat, poultry, fish, breads, pastries, and foods for special diets. They have displayed proficiency in seasoning and flavoring, applied cooking methods, and evaluated basic nutrition in foods.

964db2d8-243d-4782-bcb1-83619f445417.description: The badge earner can use traditional pastry ingredients and vegan-specific ones to prepare a variety of vegan desserts, including pies, tarts, cakes, quick breads, cookies, bars, creams, chocolate dishes, gluten-free and raw. They can adapt recipes to plant-based versions using vegan ingredients such as fats, sugar, thickeners, egg replacements, and flavorings. The badge earner displayed the creative use of plating, garnish, and plating, based on Fran Costigan's popular Vegan Baking Boot Camp.

38028e57-abc0-4fc0-a99a-2178437abf60.description: The badge earner demonstrated competency and knowledge in plant-based techniques, kitchen and food safety, knife skills, stocks, moist- and dry-heat cooking methods, plating and presentation, and culinary nutrition. 075272f4-1385-4c5d-a60a-6ae72713bb5b.description: The badge earner demonstrated competency and knowledge in plant-based techniques, grilling methods, recipe development, fermentation, and smartphone food photography. The badge earner can prepare a variety of global dishes, breads, meat substitutes, desserts, and foods for special diets. They have evaluated the importance of whole, minimally-processed, and nutrient-dense foods in a plant-based diet. This badge includes new content from the Plant-Based Professional Certification course.

46190278-96e8-4376-a15a-4d63b44a46a0.description: Seafood Literacy with Barton Seaver prepares badge earners to demonstrate foundational techniques and knowledge needed to include more sustainable seafood on the menu from product to plate. The badge earner can apply common culinary techniques to seafood cookery, identify a diverse range of seafood types, and safely handle and fabricate various forms of seafood. They have displayed proficiency in seafood sourcing from sea to table and seafood quality analysis, handling and fabrication.
46190278-96e8-4376-a15a-4d63b44a46a0.name: Seafood Literacy (v.1)

issuer.summary: issued by Rouxbe Online Culinary Training

alignments.name: Association of Nutrition & Foodservice Professionals
alignments.description: Seafood Literacy is approved for 14 continuing education units by the Certifying Board for the Dietary Managers (CBDM) as a Prior Approved Program.

alignments.name: American Culinary Federation Educational Foundation
alignments.description: Seafood Literacy is recognized as an American Culinary Federation Education Foundation Approved Program for 14 Continuing Education hours.

alignments.name: The James Beard Foundation
alignments.description: Seafood Literacy is a partner of the Smart Catch program by the The James Beard Foundation provides training and support to chefs so they can serve seafood that is produced in sustainable ways.

alignments.name: FishWatch: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration
alignments.description: Seafood Literacy is a partner of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's program FishWatch, advocating how U.S. seafood is responsibly harvested and grown under a strong monitoring, management, and enforcement regime that works to keep the marine environment healthy, fish populations thriving, and our seafood industry on the job.
